  • Description: On March 10th two packages were discovered during the PM sort that contained UN2880, Calcium Hypochlorite, hydrated, 5.1, II. The packages were brown boxes that had no markings or labels indicating the contents were dangerous goods. There was a suspicion of DG in the unmarked packages so they were opened and discovered a plastic pail in each, fully marked as a regulated dangerous good. The packages are being held pending investigation.

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 11, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was forked and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the sire. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums and the damaged drum was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025030157
item.description:
Report E-2025030157

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding several leaking plastic jugs containing hazardous product, Isopropyl Alcohol 70%. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 21-gallon release of product onto cardboard and the wooden trailer floor in a 4x4 area as a result of improper loading. The contractor containerized 84-bottles of product into one 55-gallon DM for waste disposal. Another 55-gallon DM was generated for waste disposal containing impacted cardboard and debris. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025030167
item.description:
Report E-2025030167

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 21500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured tote containing hazardous product, BONDERITE C-AK ZX-1 ALKALINE CLEANER. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 200-gallon release onto the concrete dock floor and parking lot in a 100x70 area as a result of a forklift puncture. Oil dry was applied to the released material and a tote transfer was performed for the residual product left inside of the damaged tote. In total, 23 drums of waste were generated from this response that were taken by the contractor and staged at their location for waste management. The customer refused the new tote with the transferred product, so XPO staged the tote in the waste area for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: On March 10, 2025, one (1) 3800-KG tote of nitric acid leaked approximately three (3) gallons to the trailer floor and gravel due to a faulty gasket. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

The contractor placed the proper gasket and sealed the man way lid properly. The car is still in Houston awaiting an OTMA from the shipper to continue in transportation.

  • Description: On March 7, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3265 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Burke Environmental (BE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents, neutralizers, and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum. The crew transferred the contents of the tote into one (1) new 325-gallon tote.

item.title: Report E-2025030095
item.description:
Report E-2025030095

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: FREEHOLD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer and an 8-by-3 area of roadway. They confirmed that two (2) gallons of material was released from one (1) 55-gallon drum due to being punctured while being loaded by the customer. There was one (1) drum of product involved in this release. After assessing the roadway, the truck was taken back to a terminal for additional cleaning. Clean Harbors personnel containerized the remaining product into one drum to be shipped on. They then overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum and used one (1) 55-gallon metal drum to containerize the spent absorbents used in the cleaning of the trailer. Clean Harbors personnel staged the generated waste onsite before departing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025030110
item.description:
Report E-2025030110

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: Winnipeg
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAY & ROSS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 6, 202, at 0900 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Day & Ross personnel in Winnipeg, Manitoba regarding the release of Sodium Bisulfite Solution. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 10.5 gallons of Sodium Bisulfite Solution (UN2693, 8, III) from (1) 275-gallon poly tote onto the concrete dock. The release was due to a screw protruding from the bottom of the pallet that punctured the tote underneath, impacting a 10 x 10 area of the concrete dock. No drains or waterways were found to be impacted by the release. The release was cleaned with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFs which were staged onsite, along with the damaged tote, by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025030266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Jonathan Ellis, 149 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3378 Sodium Carbonate spill on the trailer floor. Jonathan Ellis advised 4 drums on 1 pallet and is unsure what drum the spill is coming from. Jonathan Ellis stated the freight was blocked and braced tightly with other freight on the trailer. Jonathan Ellis also advised that he does not see any punctures. Jonathan Ellis stated the trailer does have powdered milk on the trailer but believes the spill is UN3378 due to the residue on the pallet of UN3378. Brock Sisney with CURA has been contacted for remediation.

  • Description: On March 5, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of gasoline was damaged by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the released gasoline. All impacted material and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. No soil, drains, or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to assist with cleanup. E3 Environmental deployed microblaze and granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one, 55-gallon drum and transported off-site for proper disposal.

  • Description: On March 4, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all the released paint. The damaged pail and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025030065
item.description:
Report E-2025030065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8-by-10 area They estimated that twenty-five (25) ounces of material were released due to manufacturer packaging being poorly sealed on the product bags. There were four impacted bags during the release. Hepaco personnel used a HEPA filtered shop vacuum to clean up the material. The vacuumed material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with the 4 damaged bags and PPE. The undamaged bags in the shipment were restacked and shrink-wrapped to ship on. Hepaco personnel staged the generated waste onsite before departing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030469
item.description:
Report X-2025030469

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERD LEAKING THROUGH THE CATWALK BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-B. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND CLEANED UP (APPROX 2 GALLONS PRODUCING A 4' FT RADIUS PUDDLE), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A FRACTURE ALONG THE SEAM ON THE BOTTOM OF A POLY 5-GAL CLOSED-HEAD PAIL, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Description: GATX 28473 was found in the Dayton, TX yard leaking from the manway when the car was moved on 3/3/2025. A BNSF Contractor was dispatched, investigated GATX 28473 and determined the release was due to a bad manway gasket and 3 of 6 manway bolts less than tool tight. The gasket was replaced and the car was properly secured. The release was contained to the car and did not impact the ground.

  • Description: On March 3, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group, Inc (GSSG) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon drum and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On February 28, 2025, four (4) 7-gallon pails of resin solution had faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pails in two (2) 55-gallon drums. E3 utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove any sign of product. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail.

  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR SENT TO PACKAGE CENTER TO PICK UP UNAUDITED HAZMATS AND CAME BACK WITH THIS PACKAGE AS WELL. PACKAGE DRIVER REPORTED THAT THE SHIPPER HAD TOLD THEM THE DAY PRIOR THAT THEY WOULD HAVE A HAZMAT SHIPMENT, BUT THE DRIVER DID NOT REALIZE UNTIL THEY WERE BACK THAT THEY DID NOT SEE ANY HAZMAT SHIPMENTS. THE CLERK OPENED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION TO CONFIRM THAT IT WAS OR WAS NOT HAZARDOUS AND WHEN SHE SAW THE GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY, SHE MADE SURE IT WAS HANDED OVER TO THE DMP. REWRAP; NO LEAK

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:56 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal LDA. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Rocryl 410 released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to the lid being improperly secured. The release impacted trailer #3214168. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 228771-1 was created, one 95-gallon poly drum containing Oil Dri and one 55-gallon metal drum containing leftover product. CHEMTREC was notified of the release, report #2025022600087 was given by Charlie. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025030507
item.description:
Report X-2025030507

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02-25-2025 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Mechanical employee regarding a strong chemical odor coming from tank car SHQX 51073. Car is in the CN Kirk Yard in Gary, IN. The employee notified the Mechanical Supervisor who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer and Emergency response contractor upon arrival and inspection found icing on the 2# A end liquid valve. It was found that the valve handle was not in the fully closed position. The plug was also found to be less than tool tight allowing product to leak out. The 2" A end liquid valve was closed stopping the release. The plug was loosened allowing the residual product to vent and the valve to thaw. The securement was confirmed with an air monitor which showed non detect. The securement plug was then installed.

item.title: Report X-2025030262
item.description:
Report X-2025030262

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING NORMAL UNLOADING PROCESS ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING A DARK LIQUID. AN EMPLOYEE WAS EXPOSED TO THE UNKNOWN DARK LIQUID CAUSING A NEGATIVE REACTION. THE SUBSTANCE BEGAN EATING AWAY THE SHIRT AND A BURNING SENSATION WAS FELT ON THEIR ABDOMEN AREA. ONSITE IMMEDIATE ACTION WAS TAKEN TO REMOVE THEIR SHIRT AND WASH THE AFFECTED AREA. EMPLOYEE WAS THEN TREATED AT A LOCAL CLINIC AND RELEASED. RESPONDER INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO FIND FOUR X ONE LITER JUGS OF CORROSIVE HERCULES CLOBBER EMERGENCY DRAIN OPENER. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER K1012B, CORPUS WAREHOUSE, 2050 SARATOGA BLVD, CORPUS CHRISTI TX 78417-3403.THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025030098
item.description:
Report E-2025030098

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 20, a Veolia employee was unloading a trailer at Veolia's Richmond facility. The employee removed a 275 gallon IBC tote from the trailer using a forklift and placed it on the ground. The employee then went to grab the next pallet, and as he was placing it down, he noticed a small stain of liquid on the ground underneath the tote. Upon noticing that liquid was dripping onto the ground, the employee grabbed absorbent pads and placed it around the tote to prevent the spill from spreading. Approximately two ounces of hazardous waste liquid spilled within the two minutes it took to control the spill. The material in the tote was transferred to another tote using a gravity feed. It was determined that the leak originated from the bottom of the tote since there was no evidence of visible damage to any other part of the tote. However, since the tote was inside a cage, it was not possible to pinpoint the exact location of the hole on the bottom of the tote.

item.title: Report E-2025020411
item.description:
Report E-2025020411

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2 feet by 2 feet area of concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a forklift accident puncturing one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Clean Harbors personnel stated that absorbents had been applied, and a neutralizer was used to the affected concrete area. The personnel then began a tote transfer from the punctured tote to a new tote. The old tote was cut up and placed in two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the impacted absorbents. The two (2) 55-gallon poly drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. Personnel were told the 330-gallon tote of product would be shipped on to the customer. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: This was a single vehicle accident in which our driver gradually left the roadway onto the slopped shoulder area. the driver attempted to return the vehicle onto the roadway, this initiated the rollover sequence. item.title: Report E-2025020243
item.description:
Report E-2025020243

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: San Jose
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 253900
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver was traveling about 7 mph while attempting to make a U-turn on a remote road. Tires on passenger side of trailer entered soft shoulder causing trailer to roll. There were no 3rd parties, no injuries, and some damage to barbwire fence and street sign. Crisis Center was notified and activated. Local Vehicle Recovery Teams from Galt and Santa Clara have responded to the scene. Local fire department responded to scene. Corporate Safety and Environmental notified. Our Air Products driver arrived at the scheduled delivery location with a fully loaded Nitrogen trailer when he approached a gate. The driver exited his vehicle and quickly determined he was at the wrong location. Upon returning to his vehicle, he decided to perform a U-Turn on a narrow two-lane road which had an incline. During the maneuvering, the back end of the trailer dug into soft shoulder and mud, the weight of the trailer pushed the tractor which caused the trailer to break away from the 5th wheel and roll against the tractor. The trailer then rolled over onto its side across the roadway. The trailer released liquid Nitrogen due to the PSV line being damaged. During the roll over event, the tractors fuel tank was ruptured causing a diesel spill onto the ground. There were no injuries reported, and no other vehicles involved in this incident.

item.title: Report I-2025020052
item.description:
Report I-2025020052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: SHARPSBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 165400
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Truck driver lost control of vehicle, struck cement barrier on side of roadway. Driver over corrected causing the trailer to sway, then rollover. Unit remained on roadway and no other vehicles were involved. This trailer consisted of 4 compartments. The last compartment received a puncture spilling 2,000 gals. of ULSD B2. The product ran down the roadway and entered storm drains that discharged rain fall into Pine Creek. Pine Creek discharges into The Allegheny River approximately 1 /2 mile downstream from the spill. The duration of the release was immediate & flowed freely until fire department was on scene. The trailer was an aluminum MC 306 built by Custom in the year 1995. Multiple fire departments were on scene along with the PA State Police, Allegheny County Hazmat, Etna Baro Police and others. On initial impact a fire started from product spilled along the barrier wall when contacted and ruptured. The fire department extinguished with no incident. The driver exited from the cab on his own, transported to ER and released with no injuries other than a cut on his hand. The fire departments blocked the drains with booms and other material to stop any continuous flow that could occur. A HM Spill Contractor was called to remove the remaining ULSD from the other 3 compartments. The trailer needed to be drilled to install a pump out hose into the tank. Product was transferred without further incident. The contractor was completing cleanup while the action of pumping the trailer was done. After the truck was righted and removed from the scene under tow, the contractor continued with the cleanup under the supervision of the PennDOT responder. Fire crews installed booms in the creek and at the mouth where the creek empties into the Allegheny River. The creek and river are an ongoing project to retain and remove product. Multiple state and local agencies are involved in monitoring the spill cleanup actions.

It was reported that approximately 4 cups of Bloc 8n Naphthoquinone solution released from a metal drum due to unknown cause The release impacted inside trailer#313-2895. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor and the steel grate on the trailer floor in a 2x3 area as a result of improper loading. The contractor cleaned-up the release using oil dry and overpacked the damaged drum into one 95-fallon DF for waste disposal. A 16-gallon DF containing impacted pallet pieces was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all the waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: t 0415 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XAN. It was reported that approximately 100 gallons of Enviroset 40E FNB Resin were released from a 275-gallon plastic tote due to improper loading by XAN. The release impacted trailer #4413259 and the concrete outside the trailer. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 200-gallons of UN2874 Enviroset 40E FNB Resin product released to the entire wooden trailer floor and the concrete beneath the trailer which spread to nine trailer bays, as well as sewer drain was impacted. The contractor applied speedy dry to the release that impacted the concrete and placed booms around the drains as well as the outfall. The estimated 10-gallons still in the tote was solidified with speedy dry and the tote were placed in a roll off for disposal. The contractors flushed the impacted sewer drain and vacuumed and filled (3) totes with impacted water/product. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On February 6, 2025, at 0821 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Helena, AR regarding the release of Vydate C-LV. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of approximately 25.0 gallons of Vydate C-LV (UN2991, 6.1 (3), II) from (1) 275-gal poly tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt. The release was reportedly due to the totes securement strap gouging the top of the poly tote bladder causing a release in transit, impacting multiple areas of the trailer floor and asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote to a new tote to continue on to the consignee. The damaged tote was shredded and containerized by the contractors. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF which were left offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

All product was recovered, site was restored to preexisting condition, and no further action is planned. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

Personnel observed approximately 50 gallons of product released impacting an 8' x 15' area underneath the trailer and an 8' x 25' area of the trailer floor. Personnel advised they unloaded the trailer and used absorbents to contain the spill, additionally they used sodium bicarbonate solution to neutralize impacted areas along with simple green to clean. Hepaco advised they completed the tote transfer and that roughly 200 gallons were transferred into the new poly tote. The impacted tote was cut up and the bulk of the impacted solids was removed from the trailer. Hepaco personnel confirmed the trailer floor has been cleaned and neutralized, pH read came back balanced. They generated eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums containing spent absorbents, PPE, impacted pallets, poly sheeting and cut up tote. ESTES approved of the work completed.

item.title: Report E-2025030088
item.description:
Report E-2025030088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ES&H was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the dock floor and estimated thirty (30) to forty (40) gallons of material was released due to a pallet on a forklift striking the tote and damaging the valve. The spill area measured approximately 10 wide by 10 long. ES&H transferred the remaining product into a new, undamaged tote. The old tote was cut up and containerized into (2) 55-gallon DMs along with some impacted granular absorbents. There was a third drum, 85-gallon DM, that was started by the terminal personnel and contained impacted absorbents. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

  • Description: Driver arrived at 3m location in Brownwood and noticed leaking from the drums. Driver had picked up a big steel pipe earler driver had it strapped to the wall, during transit the strap broke and the steel pipe rolled into the drums, puncturing 3 drums the size of a pin hole. 3m associates would not let the driver unload or touch the freight until Hazmat one arrived to clean up the spill. Cardboard and kitty litter were put down to contain the material until Hazmat one arrived.

item.title: Report I-2025020053
item.description:
Report I-2025020053

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-13T00:52:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-28
  • City: Plaquemine
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: After material was unloaded into consignee's storage tank and valves closed, driver was disconnecting hose to tank piping when pressure in hose allowed residue in hose to be released. Small amount of material sprayed onto driver PE and went under gloves onto driver's hand. Driver removed gloves and went to Emergency Showers to rinse material from PPE and skin., For driver protection and care he was transported to the hospital ER for evaluation and treatment of skin burn. Driver released from ER and sent home for night. Following day Driver evaluated by personal doctor who recommended he needed surgery to remove some damaged tissue and application of healing skin treatments. Driver admitted to hospital for procedures. Supplemental report will be filed with additional information.
